org.bonitasoft.engine.api

Interface ProcessManagementAPI

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ProcessAPI, ProcessAPI, ProcessManagementAPI

    public interface ProcessManagementAPI
    This API deals with definition objects such as ProcessDefinition, ProcessDeploymentInfo, Category, ... It enables interaction with the lifecycle of the process definition.
    Author:
    Baptiste Mesta, Matthieu Chaffotte, Yanyan Liu, Hongwen Zang, Zhang Bole, Elias Ricken de Medeiros, Celine Souchet, Arthur Freycon, Emmanuel Duchastenier

    • Method Detail

      • deploy

        ProcessDefinition deploy(BusinessArchive businessArchive)
                         throws AlreadyExistsException,
                                ProcessDeployException
        Deploys a BusinessArchive which contains a DesignProcessDefinition and its dependencies.
        Parameters:
        businessArchive - the archive to deploy.
        Returns:
        the process definition.
        Throws:
        AlreadyExistsException - if a process with same name and version is already deployed.
        ProcessDeployException - if an exception occurs when deploying the archive.
        Since:
        6.0
        See Also:
        BusinessArchive

      • deploy

        ProcessDefinition deploy(DesignProcessDefinition designProcessDefinition)
                         throws AlreadyExistsException,
                                ProcessDeployException
        Deploys a simple DesignProcessDefinition (without any dependencies).
        Parameters:
        designProcessDefinition - the description of a process definition.
        Returns:
        the process definition corresponding of the description.
        Throws:
        AlreadyExistsException - if a process with same name and version is already deployed.
        ProcessDeployException - if an exception occurs when deploying the process.
        Since:
        6.0
        See Also:
        deploy(BusinessArchive)

      • enableProcess

        void enableProcess(long processDefinitionId)
                   throws ProcessDefinitionNotFoundException,
                          ProcessEnablementException
        Enables the process definition.
        Parameters:
        processDefinitionId - the process definition identifier.
        Throws:
        ProcessDefinitionNotFoundException - if the identifier does not refer to an existing process definition.
        ProcessEnablementException - if an exception occurs during the process enablement.
        Since:
        6.0

      • disableProcess

        void disableProcess(long processDefinitionId)
                    throws ProcessDefinitionNotFoundException,
                           ProcessActivationException
        Disables the process definition by giving its identifier. A process can only be disabled if it is enabled.
        Parameters:
        processDefinitionId - the process definition identifier.
        Throws:
        ProcessDefinitionNotFoundException - if the identifier does not refer to an existing process definition.
        ProcessActivationException - if an exception occurs during the process disablement.
        Since:
        6.0

      • getProcessDefinition

        ProcessDefinition getProcessDefinition(long processDefinitionId)
                                       throws ProcessDefinitionNotFoundException
        Returns the process definition by giving its identifier. If the identifier is null, a ProcessDefinitionNotFoundException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        processDefinitionId - the identifier of the process definition.
        Returns:
        the process definition referenced by the identifier.
        Throws:
        ProcessDefinitionNotFoundException - if the identifier does not refer to an existing process definition.
        RetrieveException - if an exception occurs when getting the process definition.
        Since:
        6.0

      • deleteProcess

        @Deprecated
void deleteProcess(long processDefinitionId)
                   throws DeletionException
        Deprecated. As of release 6.1, replaced by deleteProcessDefinition(long)
        Deletes a process definition by giving its identifier. A process can only be deleted if it is disabled.
        Parameters:
        processDefinitionId - the identifier of the process definition.
        Throws:
        DeletionException - if an exception occurs during process deletion.
        ProcessInstanceHierarchicalDeletionException - if a process instance cannot be deleted because of a parent that is still active
        Since:
        6.0
        See Also:
        deleteProcessDefinition(long)

      • deleteProcesses

        @Deprecated
void deleteProcesses(List<Long> processDefinitionIds)
                     throws DeletionException
        Deprecated. As of release 6.1, replaced by deleteProcessDefinitions(List)
        Deletes process definitions by giving their identifiers. If any speciofied identifier does not refer to a real process definition, or if an exception occurs, no process definition is deleted.
        Parameters:
        processDefinitionIds - the list of identifiers of process definitions.
        Throws:
        DeletionException - if an exception occurs during process deletion.
        ProcessInstanceHierarchicalDeletionException - if a process instance cannot be deleted because of a parent that is still active
        Since:
        6.0
        See Also:
        deleteProcessDefinitions(List)

      • deleteProcessDefinition

        void deleteProcessDefinition(long processDefinitionId)
                             throws DeletionException
        Deletes a process definition by giving its identifier. A process can only be deleted if it is disabled and it has no more existing process instances.
        Parameters:
        processDefinitionId - the identifier of the process definition.
        Throws:
        DeletionException - if an exception occurs during process deletion.
        Since:
        6.1

      • deleteProcessDefinitions

        void deleteProcessDefinitions(List<Long> processDefinitionIds)
                              throws DeletionException
        Deletes process definitions by giving their identifiers. If any speciofied identifier does not refer to a real process definition, or if an exception occurs, no process definition is deleted. All instances of given processes must be deleted prior to calling this operation.
        Parameters:
        processDefinitionIds - the list of identifiers of process definitions.
        Throws:
        DeletionException - if an exception occurs during process deletion.
        Since:
        6.1
        See Also:
        deleteProcess(long)

      • deployAndEnableProcess

        ProcessDefinition deployAndEnableProcess(DesignProcessDefinition designProcessDefinition)
                                         throws ProcessDeployException,
                                                ProcessEnablementException,
                                                AlreadyExistsException,
                                                InvalidProcessDefinitionException
        Deploys, enables and returns a process.
        Parameters:
        designProcessDefinition - the description of a process definition.
        Returns:
        ProcessDefinition the process definition corresponding of the description.
        Throws:
        AlreadyExistsException - if a process with same name and version was already deployed.
        ProcessEnablementException - if a process cannot be enabled.
        InvalidProcessDefinitionException - if the designProcessDefinition is invalid.
        ProcessDeployException - if an exception occurs when deploying the process.
        Since:
        6.0
        See Also:
        deploy(DesignProcessDefinition), enableProcess(long)

      • deployAndEnableProcess

        ProcessDefinition deployAndEnableProcess(BusinessArchive businessArchive)
                                         throws ProcessDeployException,
                                                ProcessEnablementException,
                                                AlreadyExistsException
        Deploys and enables a process by giving a BusinessArchive.
        Parameters:
        businessArchive - the archive ready to deploy.
        Returns:
        ProcessDefinition Process definition by given a business archive.
        Throws:
        ProcessDeployException - if an exception occurs when deploying the archive.
        AlreadyExistsException - if a process with same name and same version already exists.
        ProcessEnablementException - if a process cannot be enabled.

      • getProcessResolutionProblems

        List<Problem> getProcessResolutionProblems(long processDefinitionId)
                                           throws ProcessDefinitionNotFoundException
        Returns a list of problems if the process is configured incorrectly or the configuration is incomplete.
        Parameters:
        processDefinitionId - the process definition identifier.
        Returns:
        a list of problems or an empty list.
        Throws:
        ProcessDefinitionNotFoundException - if the identifier does not refer to an existing process definition.
        RetrieveException - if an exception occurs when getting the problems of the process definition.
        Since:
        6.0

void disableAndDelete(long processDefinitionId)
                      throws ProcessDefinitionNotFoundException,
                             ProcessActivationException,
                             DeletionException
        Deprecated. As of release 6.1, replaced by disableAndDeleteProcessDefinition(long)
        Disables and deletes the process.
        Parameters:
        processDefinitionId - the process definition identifier.
        Throws:
        ProcessDefinitionNotFoundException - if the identifier does not refer to an existing process definition.
        ProcessActivationException - if an exception occurs while disabling the process.
        DeletionException - if an exception occurs while deleting the process.

        6.0

                                 throws ProcessDefinitionNotFoundException,

        processDeploymentInfoUpdater - the description which describe how to update the process deployment information.

                                                    int maxResults,
                                                    ProcessDeploymentInfoCriterion sortCriterion)

        Parameters:
        startIndex - the index of the first result (starting from 0).
        maxResults - the maximum number of process deployment information results per page.
        sortCriterion - the sorting criterion.
        Returns:
        the ordered list of process deployment informations.
        Throws:
        RetrieveException - if an exception occurs when getting the process deployment informations.

      • getActorMembers

        List<ActorMember> getActorMembers(long actorId,
                                int startIndex,
                                int maxResults)
        Returns a paged list of members of an actor. An actor member can be a user, a role, a group, or a membership. An actor member is created when a user, role, group, or membership is mapped to the actor. No ordering must be assumed on the list of results.
        Parameters:
        actorId - the identifier of the actor.
        startIndex - the index of the first result (starting from 0).
        maxResults - the maximum number of actor members per page.
        Returns:
        the list of actor members.
        Since:
        6.0

      • getNumberOfActorMembers

        long getNumberOfActorMembers(long actorId)
        Counts the number of members mapped to the actor. An actor member can be a user, a role, a group, or a membership. An actor member is created when a user, role, group, or membership is mapped to the actor.
        Parameters:
        actorId - the identifier of the actor.
        Returns:
        the number of actors members of the actor
        Since:
        6.0

      • createCategory

        Category createCategory(String name,
                      String description)
                        throws AlreadyExistsException,
                               CreationException
        Adds a category. A category is a string that can be assigned to processes, to make it easier to identify sets of related processes. For example, you could have a category called hr to identify all HR processes, or a category called finance to identify all processes used in the purchasing and accounts departments.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the category.
        description - The description of the category.
        Returns:
        the category.
        Throws:
        AlreadyExistsException - if a category already exists with the given name.
        CreationException - if an exception occurs when creating the category.
        Since:
        6.0

      • getProcessResources

        Map<String,byte[]> getProcessResources(long processDefinitionId,
                                     String filenamesPattern)
                                       throws RetrieveException
        Returns the resources of the process according to the file names pattern. The pattern format must be relative to the root of the business archive, without starting with a '^' or '/' character. The pattern can contain forward slashes after the first character.

        filenamesPattern - the pattern to retrieve the resources.
        Returns:

      • getProcessDeploymentInfosWithActorOnlyForGroup

        List<ProcessDeploymentInfo> getProcessDeploymentInfosWithActorOnlyForGroup(long groupId,
                                                                         int startIndex,
                                                                         int maxResults,
                                                                         ProcessDeploymentInfoCriterion sortingCriterion)
        Returns the processes for which a specified group is the only mapped actor. This is be called before deleting a group from the organization, to make sure that there are no processes that would become unresolved as a result of removing the group. A process that has no actor mapping is unresolved and cannot be started.
        Parameters:
        groupId - the identifier of the group.
        startIndex - the index of the first result (starting from 0).
        maxResults - the maximum number of processes.
        sortingCriterion - the sort criterion.
        Returns:
        the processes that the group is the last actor.
        Since:
        6.0

      • getProcessDeploymentInfosWithActorOnlyForGroups

                                                                          int startIndex,
                                                                          int maxResults,
                                                                          ProcessDeploymentInfoCriterion sortingCriterion)
        Returns the processes for which one of the listed groups is the only mapped actors. This is be called before deleting a group from the organization, to make sure that there are no processes that would become unresolved as a result of removing one of the listed groups. A process that has no actor mapping is unresolved and cannot be started.
        Parameters:

        startIndex - the index of the first result (starting from 0).
        maxResults - the maximum number of processes.
        sortingCriterion - the sort criterion.
        Returns:
        the processes that the groups are the last actor(s).
        Since:
        6.0

      • createProcessSupervisorForUser

        ProcessSupervisor createProcessSupervisorForUser(long processDefinitionId,
                                               long userId)
                                                 throws CreationException,
                                                        AlreadyExistsException
        Adds the user as a supervisor of the process. A supervisor of a process is responsible for what happens to the process. A supervisor can see the tasks in the process, and can carry out process administration. A supervisor is defined in a ProcessSupervisor object as a mapping of users, groups, or roles to the process supervisor (similar to actor mapping). A process has one ProcessSupervisor; however, as this can be mapped to several users, either explicitly or by mapping groups or roles, the process can be supervised by several people.
        Parameters:
        processDefinitionId - the identifier of the process definition.
        userId - the identifier of the user.
        Returns:
        the user as a process supervisor.
        Throws:
        CreationException - if an exception occurs when creating the process supervisor.
        AlreadyExistsException - if the user is already the process supervisor.
        Since:
        6.0

      • createProcessSupervisorForRole

        ProcessSupervisor createProcessSupervisorForRole(long processDefinitionId,
                                               long roleId)
                                                 throws CreationException,
                                                        AlreadyExistsException
        Adds the role as a supervisor of the process. A supervisor of a process is responsible for what happens to the process. A supervisor can see the tasks in the process, and can carry out process administration. A supervisor is defined in a ProcessSupervisor object as a mapping of users, groups, or roles to the process supervisor (similar to actor mapping). A process has one ProcessSupervisor; however, as this can be mapped to several users, either explicitly or by mapping groups or roles, the process can be supervised by several people.
        Parameters:
        processDefinitionId - the identifier of the process definition.
        roleId - the identifier of the role.
        Returns:
        the role as a supervisor of the process.
        Throws:
        CreationException - if an exception occurs when creating the process supervisor.
        AlreadyExistsException - if the provided role is already a supervisor for the provided process.
        Since:
        6.0

      • createProcessSupervisorForMembership

        ProcessSupervisor createProcessSupervisorForMembership(long processDefinitionId,
                                                     long groupId,
                                                     long roleId)
                                                       throws CreationException,
                                                              AlreadyExistsException
        Adds the membership as a supervisor of the process. A supervisor of a process is responsible for what happens to the process. A supervisor can see the tasks in the process, and can carry out process administration. A supervisor is defined in a ProcessSupervisor object as a mapping of users, groups, or roles to the process supervisor (similar to actor mapping). A process has one ProcessSupervisor; however, as this can be mapped to several users, either explicitly or by mapping groups or roles, the process can be supervised by several people.
        Parameters:
        processDefinitionId - the identifier of the process definition.
        groupId - the identifier of the group.
        roleId - the identifier of the role.
        Returns:
        the membership as a supervisor of the process.
        Throws:
        CreationException - if an exception occurs when creating the process supervisor.
        AlreadyExistsException - if the provided membership (group + role) is already a supervisor for the provided process.
        Since:
        6.0

                      throws DeletionException

      • deleteSupervisor

        void deleteSupervisor(Long processDefinitionId,
                    Long userId,
                    Long roleId,
                    Long groupId)
                      throws DeletionException
        Delete the ProcessSupervisor object that is identified by this processDefinitionId, userId, roleId and groupId.

        e.g. to delete the process supervisor that is set for userId 12 and process id 255 call deleteSupervisor(255, 12, null, null)

        be careful if the user is supervisor because he is in e.g. a group of super visor calling this method with the userId will do nothing, you must find the ProcessSupervisor that link the user to the process

        Parameters:
        processDefinitionId - the Identifier of the process definition to delete the supervisor for.
        userId - the Id of the user used as a supervisor for the given process. Can be null.
        roleId - the Id of the role used as a supervisor for the given process. Can be null.
        groupId - the Id of the group used as a supervisor for the given process. Can be null.
        Throws:
        DeletionException - if a problem occurs while deleting the supervisor for the given process.
        Since:
        6.0

      • getPossibleUsersOfHumanTask

        List<User> getPossibleUsersOfHumanTask(long processDefinitionId,
                                     String humanTaskName,
                                     int startIndex,
                                     int maxResults)
        Lists the possible users (candidates) of the specified human task definition. If the task contains a user filter, it is not executed. Users are ordered by user name. An empty list is returned if: - the task or the process does not exist - the flow node is not a human task
        Parameters:
        processDefinitionId - the identifier of process definition
        humanTaskName - the name of the human task
        startIndex - the start index
        maxResults - the list of users
        Returns:
        the list of users.
        Throws:
        InvalidSessionException - If the session is invalid (expired, unknown, ...)
        RetrieveException - If an exception occurs while retrieving the users
        Since:
        6.1
